decks.notes: This deck focuses on using artifacts to ramp up quickly and disrupt opponent's strategies while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Mishra's Workshop allows for explosive starts, while Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and threats. Cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Sphere of Resistance slow down opponents, allowing the deck to overpower them with efficient creatures like Scrawling Crawler and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck can also utilize land destruction with Strip Mine and Wasteland to further disrupt opponents while maintaining its own resources with cards like Crucible of Worlds and Inventors' Fair.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving The One Ring, Time Vault, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to create a devastating aggro strategy. By using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop to ramp up mana quickly, the deck can establish a strong board presence with creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler. With support from cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Mana Crypt, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts, backed by utility spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge.

The key concept of this Aggro-MUD deck is to quickly disrupt opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland, Lodestone Golem, and Trinisphere while ramping into powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Nettlecyst. The deck utilizes a combination of artifact mana acceleration, land destruction, and artifact hate to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's gameplan while quickly establishing a dominant board presence to secure victory in quick fashion.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on playing aggressive hatebears that disrupt the opponent's gameplan while also putting pressure on them. The deck utilizes cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's spells, while cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer provide efficient threats. The mana base includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine, along with acceleration from Moxen and Ancient Tomb. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly closing out the game with a board presence.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game in a single turn. The deck includes a variety of draw spells and tutors to help assemble the combo quickly, while also running protection in the form of counterspells like Flusterstorm and Force of Will. By carefully sequencing spells and utilizing the stack effectively, the deck aims to set up a win condition that can be difficult for opponents to disrupt, allowing for a consistent and powerful win condition.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards like Gifts Ungiven, Stock Up, and Underworld Breach to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently utilizing its resources and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overpower the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage. With strong support from cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and key mana sources like Moxen and dual lands, this deck aims to dominate the Vintage 1 vs 1 format with its strong control strategy.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes hate cards like Karakas, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to establish board control and disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland and Strip Mine while building up a board presence with efficient creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer. The combination of aggressive creatures and hate cards allows the deck to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The focus of this deck is on controlling the game by utilizing powerful artifacts and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate advantage through card draw and mana acceleration while also locking down the opponent's board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. The deck also has the potential for explosive plays with cards like Tinker and Transmute Artifact, aiming to win the game quickly and decisively. Ultimately, it seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by manipulating the top of the library. It uses various card draw and mana acceleration spells, along with disruptive counterspells, to protect the combo and control the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value from the graveyard. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through its combo pieces while maintaining control over the opponent's actions.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures and spells. By doing so, the player can constantly bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba, while also dealing damage with Creeping Chill. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent stream of creatures and disruption through cards like Noxious Revival and Force of Will. Bazaar of Baghdad is used to filter through the deck and enable Dredge cards to be utilized effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell using Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, allowing for powerful graveyard interactions like Dredge and reanimating creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces, as well as cards like Creeping Chill for additional reach. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Blazing Rootwalla and Vengevine, while also disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap. The key strategy revolves around utilizing the powerful card advantage engine of Bazaar of Baghdad to dig through the deck, enabling explosive starts and efficient use of resources. By combining efficient threats with disruption and card selection, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from multiple angles and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while applying pressure with efficient aggressive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Clarion Conqueror. The deck also includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further slow down the opponent's strategy. By combining hatebears and aggro elements, this deck seeks to control the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can execute their own game plan effectively.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly and efficiently control the game while utilizing the Oath of Druids card to cheat powerful creatures into play. The deck includes a strong lineup of mana acceleration cards, disruption spells, and card advantage cards to support the control strategy. By using Show and Tell and Forbidden Orchard alongside Oath of Druids, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Force of Will to further disrupt opponents' plans and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources and powerful artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements. By creating a resource advantage and generating tempo through cards like Mystic Forge and Sensei's Divining Top, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence quickly. The combination of aggressive creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Patchwork Automaton, alongside disruptive elements such as Lodestone Golem and Talon Gates of Madara, allows for a proactive game plan that can quickly close out games. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile cards like Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring provides additional flexibility and utility in various situations.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells and disrupt their mana base. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The mana acceleration provided by cards like Black Lotus and Moxen allow the deck to play its threats ahead of schedule, while cards like Cavern of Souls protect its creatures from countermagic.
